term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - time-resolved microwave conductivity
term.title: time-resolved microwave conductivity

item.text: Technique allowing the quantitative and qualitative detection of radiation-induced changes in the real, ΔReσ, and imaginary, ΔImσ, components of the conductivity of a medium by time-resolved measurement of changes in the microwave absorption resulting from the formation of mobile charges or from changes in the dipole moment or polarizability of molecules on excitation.

notes.item: From ΔReσ (corresponding to a change in the dielectric loss, Δεʺ) the product of the yield and the mobility of charges carriers or the dipole moment change can be determined. From ΔImσ (corresponding to a change in the relative permittivity, Δεʹ) the product of the yield and the change in molecular polarizability can be determined.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 433 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
